title: Clavis identification key schema
description: Clavis-compliant keys contain knowledge that may be used to distinguish taxa from each other.

$schema.description: The schema url of (this) schema defining the format of the key.

media.description: The logo/illustration image of the key.

description.description: Short description of the key (valid markdown).

descriptionDetails.description: Extended description of the key that supplements the description (valid markdown).

descriptionUrl.description: Hyperlink to more information on the key (valid url).

audience.description: Description of the intended audience for the key.

examples: Koch, Wouter (2019). Birds of Norway. ISBN 1234567890

sourceUrl.description: Hyperlink to the source of the key (valid url).

geography.description: The region for which the key is valid (e.g. covers all subtaxa), represented as a geography object.

primaryContact.description: The organization- or person-id that is the main contact point for the key.

creator.description: The id(s) of the creator(s) of the key

contributor.description: The id(s) of the contributor(s) of the key

publisher.description: The id(s) of the publishing institutions of the key.

license.description: The url to the license under which the key falls.

language.description: The ISO 639-1 code(s) of the key language(s).
language.comment: String for a single language, array of strings for multilingual support. If used as an array, be sure to use the localizedString and localizedUrl as arrays too.

created.description: The moment the key was made or first published, as 'YYYY-MM-DD hh:mm:ss'.

lastModified.description: The most recent moment the key was modified, as 'YYYY-MM-DD hh:mm:ss'.

identifier.description: The GUID of this key (persistent regardless of version).

url.description: The url of where the key lives (to check for newer versions).

externalServices.description: Services used by the key for lookups of images, taxa, etc.

userRequirements.description: Requirements to the users of the various characters, so that the user can be warned, helped, etc.

taxa.description: Taxa (e.g. species) the key can resolve to. Do not have to be exclusively taxonomic units.
taxa.comment: Taxa to which the key can resolve (either the taxa directly or their children).

characters.description: Characters (questions, e.g. 'Wing color' or 'Number of spots') used to distinguish between two or more taxa.

statements.description: Relationships between taxa and character states (or lack thereof) that define those taxa.

persons.description: Persons that are connected to (parts of) the key, such as creators.

organizations.description: Organizations that are connected to (parts of) the key or persons, such as employers and publishers.

mediaElements.description: Media elements that are used in the key.

localizedString.description: Language-dependent string or object of strings, with keys corresponding to the languages supported by the key.

localizedUrl.description: Language-dependent urls or object of urls, corresponding to the languages supported by the key.

localizedMediaElement.description: Language-dependent media element or object of media elements, corresponding to the languages supported by the key.

id.description: Internally unique id of the localized media element.

mediaElement.description: The media element or media elements (one for each language).

url.description: String formed as a url, or an external resource.

taxonID.description: String used as an internal ID for a taxon. Lowercase alphanumeric and underscores are allowed.

characterID.description: String used as an internal ID for a character. Lowercase alphanumeric and underscores are allowed.

stateID.description: String used as an internal ID for a state. Lowercase alphanumeric and underscores are allowed.

personID.description: String used as an internal ID for a person. Lowercase alphanumeric and underscores are allowed.

organizationID.description: String used as an internal ID for an organization. Lowercase alphanumeric and underscores are allowed.

serviceID.description: String used as an internal ID for a service. Lowercase alphanumeric and underscores are allowed.

statementID.description: String used as an internal ID for a statement. Lowercase alphanumeric and underscores are allowed.

userRequirementID.description: String used as an internal ID for a user requirement. Lowercase alphanumeric and underscores are allowed.

mediaID.description: String used as an internal ID for a media element. Lowercase alphanumeric and underscores are allowed.

title.description: The title of the media file.

url.description: The reference to the media file (url or resource).

file.description: The actual media file (base64 or svg) as a data URI scheme.

width.description: The number of pixels horizontally (if a bitmap image or video).

height.description: The number of pixels vertically (if a bitmap image or video).

length.description: The length in seconds of an audio or video file.

placeholder.description: Image file that can be shown instead of the video or audio file.

creator.description: The id(s) of the creator(s) of the media file

contributor.description: The id(s) of the contributor(s) of the media file

publisher.description: The id(s) of the publishing institutions of the media file.

license.description: The url to the license under which the media file falls.

mediaElement.description: A media element (collection of various formats of the same media object).

file.description: The various formats of the same media object.

multiPolygon.description: The coordinates array of a GeoJSON MultiPolygon.

geography.description: A geographic element (name, polygon, and/or external service).

polygon.description: The geographical area(s), represented as the coordinates array of a GeoJSON MultiPolygon.

service.description: An url or external service that returns geographical information.

serviceId.description: The id to one of the externalServices defined.

externalId.description: The id of the resource at the externalService.

externalService.description: Service used by the key, for media files, taxonomy and/or nomenclature, species distributions, etc.

id.description: Internally unique id to the service.

url.description: Hyperlink to more information on the person (valid url).

media.description: A media file (image) representing the person.

affiliation.description: Organization id(s) the person is affiliated with.

url.description: Hyperlink to more information on the organization (valid url).

primaryContact.description: The person-id that is the main contact point for the organization.

media.description: A media file (image) representing the organization, such as a logo.

description.description: Short description of the requirements to the user (valid markdown).

descriptionDetails.description: Extended description of the requirements to the user that supplements the description (valid markdown).

descriptionUrl.description: Hyperlink to more information on the requirements to the user (valid url).

media.description: Media or illustration that informs the user on the requirements to the user.

id.description: Internally unique id to the taxon.

scientificNameAuthor.description: Author string of the scientific name of the taxon.

placeholderName.description: Name that can be shown while fetching the name externally. Also useful for editing the key.

description.description: Short description of the taxon (valid markdown).

descriptionDetails.description: Extended description of the taxon that supplements the description (valid markdown).

descriptionUrl.description: Hyperlink or resource to more information on the taxon.

rank.description: Name of the level of the taxon.

label.description: Type of morph of the taxon.

isEndPoint.description: Whether the key should stop when this taxon is the only remaining possibility, even when it has multiple children remaining.
isEndPoint.comment: Default is FALSE (if not specified). A taxon without children is alway an endpoint by definition, unless one of its ancestors overrides this by being specified as an endpoint.

externalReference.description: Reference to a taxon at one or more providers, each as an object with a provider id and a taxon id at that provider.
externalReference.comment: Accepts an array for multiple sources. Each element accepts an object for multilingual support.

followUp.description: Url or reference to instance at external service for a key for this taxon, that for instance can be used to identify to a lower rank than the current key can.

geography.description: The area(s) in which the taxon occurs, represented as a geography object.

id.description: Internally unique id to the character.

media.description: The media element(s) of the character. Can be used to inform user of relevant structures etc.

description.description: Short description of the character (valid markdown).

descriptionDetails.description: Extended description of the character that supplements the description (valid markdown).

descriptionUrl.description: Hyperlink or resource to more information on the character.

type.description: Type of the character (exclusive when states are categorical and mutually exclusive, non-exclusive when these are non-exclusive, or numerical when the state is numerical).

userRequirement.description: Id to the userRequirement required to answer this character.
userRequirement.comment: Has to be one of the userRequirement defined on the key level.

logicalPremise.description: Logical requirement that has to be fulfilled for this question to be asked.
logicalPremise.comment: Has to refer to stateIds, that have to be fully true (either answered or all alternatives ruled out). Can use !, &&, ||, (, ), <, >, =.

min.description: The minimum numerical value for the character.

max.description: The maximum numerical value for the character.

stepSize.description: The increments with which the numerical value of the character can be specified.

unit.description: The unit of the numerical value.

state.description: The value a character can have.

id.description: Internally unique id of the state.

title.comment: Only to be used for categorical characters. Accepts object for multilingual support.

media.description: Media element(s) that illustrate the state.

description.description: Short description of the state (valid markdown).

descriptionDetails.description: Extended description of the state that supplements the description (valid markdown).

descriptionUrl.description: Hyperlink or resource to more information on the state.

statement.description: A fact connecting a taxon and a character through a certain value.

id.description: Internally unique id of the statement.

taxon.description: Id of the taxon this statement is about.

character.description: Id of the character this statement is about.

value.description: A value for this character for this taxon. Must be either the id of a state, or an array of floats [min, max] for a numerical range.

frequency.description: The frequency with which the taxon has this value for this character.

geography.description: The area(s) in which the taxon can have this property, represented as a geography object.

media.description: Illustration(s) of this particular taxon having this particular property (this value for this character).

description.description: Short description of the taxon having this property (valid markdown).

descriptionDetails.description: Extended description of the taxon having this property that supplements the description (valid markdown).

descriptionUrl.description: Hyperlink or resource to more information on the taxon having this property.
